results.title: The Wayne manifesto: the alien
results.creator_credit: Paul Moloney, Alan Hardy, Film Finance Corporation Australia, Film Queensland and Artist Services
results.brief_description: In “A Wayne in a manger”, Wayne, his family, and his father’s toilet collection have just moved to a real dump of a house. To make matters worse they have arrived well ahead of their furniture, and just in time for Christmas. It looks like it’s going to be the worst Christmas on record. In “The Alien”, after surviving puberty and his hellish neighbours, Wayne is convinced he’s an alien, and he’s not the only one that thinks so. He enlists the help of his friends Squaka and Violet and their alien detector to get to the truth of the matter. Cast includes Jeffrey Walker (Wayne), Jah’shua McAvoy, Tracey-Louise Smith and Brooke Harman.

results.title: The Way...the eagle...(expletive deleted): an essay by Al Levin
results.brief_description: An irreverent satirical essay on U.S. economics. Shows how the ‘American Way’ depends on keeping the poor poor, both at home and abroad. Presented by journalist Al Levin.
results.title_for_label: The Way…the eagle…(expletive deleted): an essay by Al Levin

results.title: The Way we were
results.creator_credit: Sydney Pollack, Ray Stark, Rastar Productions and Columbia
results.brief_description: Barbra Streisand and Robert Redford star in one of Hollywood’s legendary love stories. Redford is the boy who sets out to become the top film writer in Hollywood and Streisand is the outspoken activist. Their love binds them together, but their beliefs put them on a collision course which ultimately tears them apart. Redford is charming as the all-American WASP boy, while Streisands performance as the “blue-stocking” Jewish activist is moving, as she vacillates between fragility and passionate committment to her causes. Although uneven and at times unashamedly sentimental, the film is a classic of its genre. Marvin Hamlisch’s score and the title song earned Oscars for the film.

results.title: The Way to independence
results.brief_description: An allegory in three parts illustrating the transition of children from dependence to independence from parental control. Over-protective, indifferent and ideal parents are shown as their child takes the vital steps “into the world”. The viewer is left to draw their own conclusions.

results.title: The Way they live there: an Egyptian village

results.title: The Way of the world
results.brief_description: Silent film exploring religious themes about a priest who ventures out into the streets amongst the workers to spread the word of god. Cast includes Henry B. Walthall, George Nichols, Florence Barker, Gertrude Claire.

results.title: The Way of the dragon = Return of the dragon
results.creator_credit: Bruce Lee, Raymond Chow and Golden Harvest
results.brief_description: Tang Lung travels to Rome to help save a family friend’s restaurant which is being threatened by a powerful gang boss. Initially seen as an embarrassment amongst his Chinese friends, Tang Lung is soon held in high esteem when he reveals his masterful martial arts skills defending the restaurant against the thugs. The gang boss begins a number of attacks on the restaurant in an effort to defeat Tang Lung. He finally flies in an American martial arts assassin to challenge Tang Lung to fight to the death. Cast includes: Bruce Lee, Nora Miao and Chuck Norris. Dubbed into English.

results.title: The Way of the dinosaur
results.brief_description: Animated parable equating the extinction of the dinosaur with the possible extinction of the human race, the parallel being that the dinosaurs couldn’t adapt to change and that the human use of non-renewable fossil fuels might see us going the same way.
results.description: Animated parable equating the extinction of the dinosaur with the possible extinction of the human race, the parallel being that the dinosaurs couldn’t adapt to change and that the human use of non-renewable fossil fuels might see us going the same way.

results.title: The Way of a river
results.brief_description: This film follows the River Test, Hampshire, from its source to its mouth in Southampton Water. It is a clear, swift-flowing trout stream, completely unmpolluted, despite factories on its lower reaches. Underwater sequences of trout spawning and a fish’s eyeview of the angler are shown.
